page.title: 16SCHOOLS IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: The old school was built around 1560.Court rolls of 1560 show that {William Elmehyrste}and{William {Broddesworth}were allowed to build a Grammar school on a piece of waste ground near to the church.Boarders were taken and they slept in the village nearby.Much later it became a Primary School and eventually closed in 1962.The building is now used partly as a private house and partly as a Church Hall were a{Thrift Shop}is held,second hand clothes are sold to boost church funds.Worsbrough Village was then without a school of its own until new housing forced the building of a new school{Worsbrough St Marys {Church of England School}in 1973.It is a small school having just three classes and 58 children on role at present.It is built on the edge of the village where it merges with Birdwell.
